value.title: Administer Power BI, Part 1 - Tenants, governance, collaboration
value.excerpt: As an administrator, how do you manage a Power BI tenant? How do you configure tenant settings, monitor usage, and provision licenses and other organizational resources? This learning path covers typical tasks and tools, such as the Power BI admin portal and Office 365 admin center. You will learn how to establish and provide governance for a Power BI environment and provision Power BI Premium capacity.

topItems.title: Understand the Power BI administrator role
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to administer Power BI to support business decisions backed by data.

topItems.title: Establish a Power BI environment
topItems.excerpt: This module covers topics relating to establishing a Power BI environment within Office 365 containers.

topItems.title: Provide governance in a Power BI environment
topItems.excerpt: Learn the fundamental rules, regulations, and policies of a BI governance approach.

topItems.title: Facilitate collaboration and sharing
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to collaborate and share dashboards and reports with coworkers.

value.title: Architect solutions for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt:
A Solution Architect is responsible for the successful design, implementation, deployment, and adoption of an overall solution. A Solution Architect ensures that the solution meets the customer‚Äôs needs now and in the future. While the Solution Architect may not ‚Äúclick the buttons‚Äù during a deployment, they are ultimately responsible for the solution and work closely with the deployment team.
This learning path covers the pre-sales and analysis phases of a project to include:

What it takes to become a Solution Architect.
Discovering customer needs.
Proposing a solution.
Working with requirements.
Performing fit-gap analysis.

Instructor-led training (ILT) is scheduled for March 2020 that provides more hands-on activities and both this path and ILT are needed for the exam.

topItems.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

topItems.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

topItems.title: Propose a solution as a Solution Architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to propose a solution.

topItems.title: Work with requirements as a solution architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: It is important to capture the customer‚Äôs needs accurately. This module explains how to capture requirements and identify functional and non-functional items.

topItems.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - ALM ToolKit with Christian Wade
topItems.excerpt: The ALM Toolkit is an excellent tool for aiding users with Tabular Model management.  Christian Wade has been generous enough to provide us with a detailed tutorial on the ALM ToolKit.    ALM Toolkit provides the following features: - Database Compare - Code Merging - Easy Deployments - Source-Control

topItems.title: Introducing DAX 101 videos
topItems.excerpt: Introductive concepts and tasks to write DAX. Short and straight to the point!

topItems.title: Previous year up to a certain date
topItems.excerpt: This video describes how to compute previous year values up to a certain date in DAX and Power BI. This technique is useful in case the data is presenting incomplete months or years. Article and download: https://sql.bi/352723?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/bAOs5LTP0I0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
topItems.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/71ERlpfhmwU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX
topItems.excerpt: Time intelligence functions oftentimes hide an automatic ALL statement meant to make time intelligence calculations easier. This video describes this behavior and what to do in case it ends up breaking your calculation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/123591
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JS-K2faCiCc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
